title: How to Make Cape Breton Tea Bannock

steps.headline: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray.
Add the flour, oats, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Cut in diced unsalted butter until the mixture looks crumbly.
Add the egg to another bowl and whisk well.
Add the buttermilk to the whisked egg.
Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and mix until a soft dough forms.
Add more buttermilk, if needed, to make a soft dough.
Spray your hands with nonstick cooking spray then form the soft dough into a ball.
steps.description: Place the ball of dough on the prepared baking sheet.

steps.headline: Spray hands again with nonstick cooking spray.
steps.description: Pat dough into a 10-inch circle about 1/2-inch thick.

steps.headline: Bake bannock for about 18 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Remove bannock from baking sheet to a wire cooling rack.
Brush the bannock with melted butter.
Cut into wedges and serve with more butter and orange marmalade.

text: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C).  Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray.  Add the flour, oats, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Mix to combine. Cut in diced unsalted butter until the mixture looks crumbly.  Add the egg to another bowl and whisk well.  Add the buttermilk to the whisked egg.  Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and mix until a soft dough forms.  Add more buttermilk, if needed, to make a soft dough.  Spray your hands with nonstick cooking spray then form the soft dough into a ball. Place the ball of dough on the prepared baking sheet. Spray hands again with nonstick cooking spray. Pat dough into a 10-inch circle about 1/2-inch thick. Bake bannock for about 18 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.  Remove bannock from baking sheet to a wire cooling rack.  Brush the bannock with melted butter.  Cut into wedges and serve with more butter and orange marmalade.
